trans-unit.source: Subject of the e-mail. In the subject, variables can be used for dynamic replacement, e.g. {variable}
Which variables can be used is different and must be inquired with their TYPO3 integrator.
In the email body variables can be used for dynamic replacement, e.g. {variable}
Which variables can be used is different and must be inquired with their TYPO3 integrator.
Overwrites the default sender of an e-mail.
The default sender of an e-mail can be defined in the InstallTool under [MAIL] [defaultMailFromAddress] and [MAIL] [defaultMailFromName].
John Doe|john.d@domain.com
Leave this field blank if you want to use dynamic recipients (for example, for a newsletter)
John Doe|john.d@domain.com
One or more recipients should be sent to the copy of the email. One recipient is allowed per line.
The listed recipients are visible to the actual e-mail recipient.
Wikipedia | https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carbon_copy
John Doe|john.d@domain.com
One or more recipients to whom a copy of the e-mail should be sent. One recipient is allowed per line.
The listed recipients are not visible to the actual e-mail recipient.
Wikipedia | https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blind_carbon_copy
John Doe|john.d@domain.com
The optional information indicates to which address an error notification is to be returned by the mail server
return-path@domain.com
One or more recipients to whom a reply to the e-mail should be sent (if different from the sender)
John Doe|john.d@domain.com
Files which are attached to the e-mail
